basics.name: Jim Beyers
basics.label: Engineering Leader
basics.summary: I spent many years in the hospitality industry which helped to shape my attitude to customer service.  This experience positions me to bridge the technical and business divide. I enjoy finding simple solutions to complex problems and enabling the business to make informed decisions to improve their processes.

publications.name: Target’s First Foray into an In-Memory Data Grid
publications.summary: 2015 saw the birth of a new product team at Target, Available to Promise (ATP) ATP is a new way to talk to guests about product availability and delivery times on target.com and is used as the the reservation engine for orders. In order to provide the guest experience that we are seeking to deliver on Target.com – the team chose to make use of an in memory data grid to serve up these features. This talk will cover what the team did right, what they did wrong, and what they were able to achieve (metrics).
